Getting Started

Source: md/getting-started.md

There's a gulp task called styelguide that's run after styles have been updated and/or after the styleguide/src/md/ files have been updated.

It's highly recommended you update the styleguide's sidebar logo and colors to match your theme.

You should also probably change this file to give a brief introduction to the project.

Using with Drupal

There's this package. That you can use with your drupal sites. But you have to rename your generated styleguide index.html to style-guide.html.

Files

Root:

  • stylemark.yml

    Configuration file. You can update the styleguide logo, set theme assets from where it will generate the styleguide, order the styleguide links in the sidebar. You can also specify the assetes for the styleguide's theming.

  • styleguide/ Styleguide assets, dist contains generated code.

    • dist/ Don't Modify

    • src/

      • css/

        Styleguide theming.

      • md/

        Markdown files where your styleguide components will live.

Buttons

Source: md/buttons.md

Button styles.

Typically:

  • btn: Default button styles, serves as a base.
  • btn--primary: Standard button.
  • btn--secondary: Button for a secondary action.
  • btn--inverse: Specifically tailored for dark backgrounds.
  • btn--block: Always full-width button.
Example 
<button class="btn">Base</button>
<input type="submit" class="btn" value="Base">
<a href="#" class="btn">Base</a>

Forms

Source: md/forms.md

Global form styles.

Example 
<form>
    <label for="">Search</label>
    <input type="search" />
    <label for="">Text</label>
    <input type="text" />
    <label for="">Email</label>
    <input type="email" />
    <label for="">URL</label>
    <input type="url" />
    <label for="">Password</label>
    <input type="password" />
    <label for="">Number</label>
    <input type="number" />
    <label for="">Date</label>
    <input type="date" />
    <label for="">Radio</label>
    <input type="radio" />
    <label for="">Reset</label>
    <input type="reset" />
    <label for="">Telephone</label>
    <input type="tel" />
    <label for="">Checkbox</label>
    <input type="checkbox" />
  <label for="">Textarea</label>
  <textarea></textarea>
  <label for="">Select</label>
  <select name="" id="">
    <option value="option-1">option-1</option>
    <option value="option-2">option-2</option>
    <option value="option-3">option-3</option>
    <option value="option-4">option-4</option>
  </select>
  <input type="submit" />
</form>

Tables

Source: md/tables.md

Global table styles.

Example 
<table>
  <caption>Clients:</caption>
  <tr>
    <th scope="col">First Name</th>
    <th scope="col">Last Name</th>
    <th scope="col">City</th>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>James</td>
    <td>Abby</td>
    <td>Daniel</td>
    <td>Lindsey</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>Jebediah</td>
    <td>Ipsum</td>
    <td>Arbz</td>
    <td>Gemms</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>Los Angeles</td>
    <td>Guadalajara</td>
    <td>Washington D.C.</td>
    <td>New Orleans</td>
    <td>Atlanta</td>
</tr>

Typography

Source: md/typography.md

Global typographic styles. Please try to use them in a logical and semantic order. For example, make sure h3's don't go before h1's.

Example 
<h1>Header 1</h1>
<h2>Header 2</h2>
<h3>Header 3</h3>
<h4>Header 4</h4>
<h5>Header 5</h5>
<h6>Header 6</h6>
<p>Paragraph style. Lorem ipsum dolor sit, amet consectetur <a href="#">adipisicing</a> elit. Molestiae incidunt porro eum aut eaque, molestias cum laboriosam amet odit autem.</p>
<blockquote>
  Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Quis quaerat corporis corrupti unde iusto ratione?
</blockquote>
<dl>
  <dt>Definitions List</dt>
  <dd>Words that define</dd>
  <dd>What the title</dd>
  <dd>Means and represents</dd>
</dl>
<a href="#">Anchor links</a>
<h3>Lists</h3>
<ol>
  <li>Ordered list item 1</li>
  <li>Ordered list item 2</li>
  <li>
    Ordered list item 3
    <ul>
      <li>Sublist item 1</li>
      <li>Sublist item 2</li>
      <li>Sublist item 3</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
  <li>Ordered list item 4</li>
  <li>Ordered list item 5</li>
</ol>

<ul>
  <li>Ordered list item 1</li>
  <li>Ordered list item 2</li>
  <li>
    Ordered list item 3
    <ol>
      <li>Sublist item 1</li>
      <li>Sublist item 2</li>
      <li>Sublist item 3</li>
    </ol>
  </li>
  <li>Ordered list item 4</li>
  <li>Ordered list item 5</li>
</ul>
